intro: Heterotheca brandegeei, commonly known as the Brandegge's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. The plant produces yellow composite flowers, which are composed of numerous small florets arranged in a radiate head. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Heterotheca brandegeei is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
